MEETING VISITING, PARTIES, ETC.

1. In the first few years, how many homes were near enough to you for visiting back and forth? How many of these were bachelor's homes?

2. How often did you usually visit neighbors?

3. Did you usually visit on a Sunday, or other days?

4. Were you often invited to other homes, or was most visiting done without an invitation? Without an invitation.

What time of the day did you go, in the morning and spend the day, or in the afternoon etc.? In the morning or in the evening.

What about meals? Did you stay when not invited beforehand? Yes.

How was the invitation to a meal worded when people had some unexpectedly? (That is, was the term to take pleasure using, or was some other expression common?)

If no meal, what other refreshment might be offered to visitors who had "developed in"? Always took a meal.

5. Did the whole family go, or did someone stay home to "look after the place"?

6. Did you ever have "bees" then groups of neighbors came together to put up a building, make quilts, or other such activity? Yes.

Tell what you remember about such gatherings giving dates if possible, telling what the "bees" were for, and how often they occurred.

Usually helped a friend by spending time & working bees.

7. In the earliest years that you were here, were there any parties, whilst driving or dancing in homes? Describe.

During the '74-'80 winters when we held up Rollin' and our friends.

Were those more frequent in later years? Give dates. 1980.

Did you follow any kind of informal schedule, such as going by turn from one house to another at definite times, every two weeks, once a month, etc.? No.

During the winter 1939-40 this crew held every week and camp.
